headline.print_headline: Investors Fret Yahoo's Future, Stock Dips
headline.main: Investors Fret Yahoo's Future, Stock Dips

docs.snippet: Yahoo may be losing some appeal on Wall Street now that U.S. investors can buy directly into Alibaba....
docs.lead_paragraph: Yahoo may be losing some appeal on Wall Street now that U.S. investors can buy directly into Alibaba.

headline.sub: Germany's Merck to acquire Sigma-Aldrich for $17 billion

docs.snippet: Karl Ludwig-Kley, chairman of Merck of Germany, and Rakesh Sachdev, chief of Sigma-Aldrich, explain deal $17 billion deal for the life sciences company....
docs.lead_paragraph: Karl Ludwig-Kley, chairman of Merck of Germany, and Rakesh Sachdev, chief of Sigma-Aldrich, explain deal $17 billion deal for the life sciences company.

headline.print_headline: Accused White House Intruder Armed in July Arrest
headline.main: Accused White House Intruder Armed in July Arrest

docs.snippet: A former Army soldier accused of sprinting across the White House lawn and into the executive mansion was heavily armed when he was arrested by Virginia state troopers after a traffic stop in July....
docs.lead_paragraph: A former Army soldier accused of sprinting across the White House lawn and into the executive mansion was heavily armed when he was arrested by Virginia state troopers after a traffic stop in July.

headline.print_headline: Traffickers Sold Tacos With a 'Side of Meth': Colorado Prosecutors
headline.main: Traffickers Sold Tacos With a 'Side of Meth': Colorado Prosecutors

docs.snippet: Authorities in Colorado broke up a drug trafficking ring and seized 55 pounds of methamphetamine, ending what prosecutors said on Monday was an audacious network that involved a food truck selling tacos "with a side of meth."...
docs.lead_paragraph: Authorities in Colorado broke up a drug trafficking ring and seized 55 pounds of methamphetamine, ending what prosecutors said on Monday was an audacious network that involved a food truck selling tacos "with a side of meth."

headline.print_headline: FBI Watching Some Americans Who Returned From Syria Conflict
headline.main: FBI Watching Some Americans Who Returned From Syria Conflict

docs.snippet: Some of the 100 Americans who went to Syria and Iraq to join up with radical groups like Islamic State have returned to the United States, U.S. officials said on Monday, amid fears that such foreign fighters could pose a security threat at home....
docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the 100 Americans who went to Syria and Iraq to join up with radical groups like Islamic State have returned to the United States, U.S. officials said on Monday, amid fears that such foreign fighters could pose a security threat at home.

headline.print_headline: Iraqi Soldiers Describe Heavy Losses as Islamic State Overruns Camp
headline.main: Iraqi Soldiers Describe Heavy Losses as Islamic State Overruns Camp

docs.snippet: Iraqi soldiers described on Monday how Islamic State fighters inflicted heavy losses in a chaotic raid on a military base just an hour's drive from Baghdad, highlighting the jihadists' ability to attack high-profile targets despite U.S. air strike...
docs.lead_paragraph: Iraqi soldiers described on Monday how Islamic State fighters inflicted heavy losses in a chaotic raid on a military base just an hour's drive from Baghdad, highlighting the jihadists' ability to attack high-profile targets despite U.S. air strikes.

headline.print_headline: U.S. SEC to Pay $30 Million-Plus in Largest Whistleblower Award
headline.main: U.S. SEC to Pay $30 Million-Plus in Largest Whistleblower Award

docs.snippet: An anonymous tipster living abroad will be receiving more than $30 million, in the largest whistleblower award ever doled out by U.S. securities regulators as part of a program that aims to incentivize insiders to report wrongdoing....
docs.lead_paragraph: An anonymous tipster living abroad will be receiving more than $30 million, in the largest whistleblower award ever doled out by U.S. securities regulators as part of a program that aims to incentivize insiders to report wrongdoing.

headline.print_headline: Atlanta Symphony, in Lockout, Cancels Concerts

docs.snippet: The orchestra locked out its musicians earlier this month, and has canceled the first seven weeks of its season, through Nov. 8....
docs.abstract: The orchestra locked out its musicians earlier this month, and has canceled the first seven weeks of its season, through Nov. 8.

headline.print_headline: St. Louis County Cops Apologize for Flier Wording
headline.main: St. Louis County Cops Apologize for Flier Wording

docs.snippet: St. Louis County police apologized Monday for the wording of a flier announcing a seminar to help officers interact with the media....
docs.lead_paragraph: St. Louis County police apologized Monday for the wording of a flier announcing a seminar to help officers interact with the media.

headline.print_headline: Frozen Barley Crops to Push Craft Beer Prices Higher in N. America
headline.main: Frozen Barley Crops to Push Craft Beer Prices Higher in N. America

docs.snippet: Beer prices in North America may rise next year as brewers and maltsters face higher costs after cold, wet weather damaged Canadian barley crops and left farmers and tipplers crying in their beer....
docs.lead_paragraph: Beer prices in North America may rise next year as brewers and maltsters face higher costs after cold, wet weather damaged Canadian barley crops and left farmers and tipplers crying in their beer.
